comment.text: The translation key "WebhookName" is used to translate the label for a form field that collects the name of a webhook in a portal settings page. This text appears as a label within a dialog modal when editing webhooks, and it should be translated to fit different languages.

usage.context:
<ModalDialog.Header>{header}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <StyledWebhookForm onSubmit={onFormSubmit}>
 <LabledInput
 id={`${additionalId}-name-input`}
 label={t("WebhookName")}
 placeholder={t("EnterWebhookName")}
 name="name"
 value={webhookInfo.name}
 onChange={onInputChange}
 hasError={!isValid.name}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation "اسم ويب هوك" is a literal translation of "Webhook name" but is not the most natural or common way to refer to it in Arabic. 'Webhook' is often transliterated.
The translation "Име на уеб кука" is a literal translation of "Webhook name" but "уеб кука" is not the standard term used in Bulgarian for "webhook". The more common and accepted term is "уебхук".

The term 'webhook' is an English loanword and should ideally be transliterated rather than translated. While 'Όνομα webhook' is understandable, a more standard transliteration would be 'Webhook όνομα'.
The translation 'Tīmekļa aizķeres nosaukums' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Webhook name'. 'Aizķere' implies a blockage or obstacle, which isn't the meaning of 'webhook'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vairāk piemērotas alternatīvas varētu būt 'Webhook nosaukums' vai 'Webhooka nosaukums'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Naam webhook' is not ideal. 'Webhook' is an English term and often used directly in Dutch. A more natural translation would be 'Webhook naam'.
While technically correct, "Nume Webhook" is not the most natural Romanian translation for "Webhook name". A more idiomatic translation would be "Numele webhook-ului".
The Sinhala translation 'Webhook නම' is a direct transliteration and doesn't convey the intended meaning of "Webhook name". It literally translates to "Webhook name" which isn't idiomatic Sinhala.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A better translation would be something like 'වෙබ්හූක් పేరు' (Webhook pera - Webhook name) or 'වෙබ්හූක් නමැᱱ පරිගණක' (Webhook namaena pariganaka - Webhook named computer/device).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation "Webhook име" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Webhook name." "Име" (ime) translates directly to 'name,' but in this context, a more common and natural phrasing would be "Назив webhook-а" (Naziv webhook-a) or simply "Webhook назив" (Webhook naziv).
